question.body: Based on our modern day understanding of the digestive system anatomy and physiology, this system would best be classified in which of the vital function categories?

multiple_choice.choice: Provide structure, support, protection and movement
Transport fluids and material throughout the body

response.feedback: Incorrect. Think about this vital function more as the whole organism in its environment; this is not its best category choice for digestive system, even though all organs have a “structure”, there are structures associated with the digestive system specifically for protection because it is another pathway for pathogens to enter the body, and food is moved through the lumen.

Correct. Because the GI tube is technically “external”, the secretion of substances for digestion into the lumen and absorption of nutrients and water from the lumen is an exchange with our environment.
Incorrect. This happens to the material that is absorbed by the digestive system cells, but it is a function of the circulatory or lymphatic systems.

Incorrect. While there is a portion of the nervous system that is specifically associated with the digestive system, called the enteric nervous system, it is still considered to be part of the nervous system and so would not be considered a major function of the digestive system.

part.hint: In theory, all systems are interrelated and contribute in some way to each vital function, but one is the best classification based on major function of the system for the organism as a whole in its environment.
